title: Mexico's president downplays Trump's threats
subhead: Though the US and Mexico signed a security agreement in September 2025, and drug seizures and arrests in Mexico have increased, on Thursday, Donald Trump floated the idea of strikes against Mexican cartels.

title: Bob Weir, Grateful Dead's founding member, has died at age 78
Trump signs emergency order to protect US-held revenue from Venezuela oil
US announces 'large-scale' strikes against IS in Syria
subhead: The strikes carried out on Saturday were part of Operation Hawkeye Strike, which was launched 'in direct response to the deadly ISIS attack on US and Syrian forces in Palmyra,' US Central Command said in a statement on X, using an acronym for the jihadist group.

title: When the damage caused by alcohol begins in utero
subhead: Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can trigger more or less severe neurodevelopmental and growth disorders. Recent studies also show that fathers' alcohol consumption prior to conception may play a harmful role as well.

title: In Los Angeles, one year after the fires: 'I will only live here if the neighborhood is rebuilt to withstand fire'
subhead: One year after massive wildfires devastated the southern coast of California, residents are laser-focused on rebuilding. But as they weigh the need for speed against the desire to build back better, they confront questions about the best way to preserve their quality of life.

title: 'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
subhead: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

title: Moses with a selfie stick, Goliath at a weightlifting competition: How AI gives the sacred new life

'In Iran, the conditions that enabled the American operation in Venezuela are not present'
subhead: Political analyst Hamzeh Safavi, whose father is an adviser to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, discusses the abduction of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by the US on January 3 in Caracas, and its impact on the Islamic Republic.

title: 'Christopher Columbus embodying Trump and Meloni's supremacist fantasies is no coincidence'
subhead: 'Debated Figures' (1/5). Once praised by French traditionalist Catholics, the 'discoverer of America' is now celebrated by American and Italian leaders, writes historian Romain Bertrand.

title: The new luxury olive oils: 'Visitors come with the same curiosity as for wine'
subhead: Olive oil has gained a new status. Championed by Michelin-starred chefs, the ingredient is now treated with the same reverence as a fine vintage wine, reflecting a precious artisanal craft. A handful of French estates are distinguishing themselves, selling their extra virgin production at premium prices.

title: France's narrow path toward a budget
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
